title: Understanding System Design with Visual Diagrams
description: Learn system design concepts through interactive visual diagrams

lessons.title: What is System Design?
lessons.content:
System design is the process of defining the architecture, modules, interfaces, and data for a system to satisfy specified requirements.

Let's visualize a simple client-server architecture:

```mermaid
graph LR
    A[Client] -->|HTTP Request| B[Load Balancer]
    B --> C[Web Server 1]
    B --> D[Web Server 2]
    C --> E[Database]
    D --> E
```

This diagram shows how client requests are distributed across multiple servers for better performance and reliability.

lessons.title: Request Flow in Web Applications
lessons.content:
Understanding how requests flow through a system is crucial. Here's a typical sequence:

```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
    participant User
    participant Browser
    participant Server
    participant Database
    
    User->>Browser: Click Button
    Browser->>Server: HTTP POST /api/data
    Server->>Database: Query Data
    Database-->>Server: Return Results
    Server-->>Browser: JSON Response
    Browser-->>User: Update UI
```

Each step in this sequence represents a critical part of the user experience.

quiz.question: Why is it important to use a load balancer in a multi-server architecture?
quiz.answer: A load balancer distributes incoming traffic across multiple servers, preventing any single server from becoming overloaded. This improves reliability, performance, and allows for better scaling.

lessons.title: Application State Flow
lessons.content:
State management is critical in modern applications. Here's how state typically flows:

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> Idle
    Idle --> Loading: User Action
    Loading --> Success: Data Received
    Loading --> Error: Request Failed
    Success --> Idle: Reset
    Error --> Idle: Retry
    Error --> [*]: Give Up
```

This state diagram shows the lifecycle of a typical data-fetching operation in an application.

lessons.title: Entity Relationships
lessons.content:
Understanding how data relates is fundamental to database design:

```mermaid
erDiagram
    USER ||--o{ POST : creates
    USER ||--o{ COMMENT : writes
    POST ||--o{ COMMENT : has
    POST }o--|| CATEGORY : belongs_to
    
    USER {
        int id
        string username
        string email
    }
    POST {
        int id
        string title
        string content
        int author_id
    }
    COMMENT {
        int id
        string text
        int user_id
        int post_id
    }
```

This entity-relationship diagram shows how users, posts, and comments connect in a blogging system.

quiz.question: What does the ||--o{ notation mean in an ER diagram?
quiz.answer: The ||--o{ notation represents a one-to-many relationship. The || side indicates 'one' and the o{ side indicates 'many'. For example, one user can create many posts.

lessons.title: Timeline and Milestones
lessons.content:
Visualizing project timelines helps with planning and tracking:

```mermaid
gantt
    title Development Timeline
    dateFormat  YYYY-MM-DD
    section Design
    Requirements Gathering :a1, 2024-01-01, 7d
    UI/UX Design          :a2, after a1, 10d
    section Development
    Backend API           :a3, after a2, 14d
    Frontend              :a4, after a2, 14d
    section Testing
    Integration Testing   :a5, after a3, 7d
    User Acceptance      :a6, after a5, 5d
    section Deployment
    Production Deploy    :a7, after a6, 2d
```

Gantt charts like this help teams visualize dependencies and critical paths in projects.
